textos_fuente.text: Staff & Directory Membership Annual Memberships Rams Club Membership Levels Recent Graduate Memberships Student Rams Club Junior Rams Club Carolina Kids Club Membership Benefits Benefits Chart Ticket Opportunities Rams Club Events Heels Deals Membership Dates Refer a New Member Upgrade Your Membership Tickets & Gameday Football Tickets Basketball Tickets Olympic Sports Tickets Turn It Blue Ticket Return Priority Point System Gameday in Chapel Hill Away Game Travel News & Dates News & Stories Born & Bred Archive Upcoming Events & Important Dates Opportunities to Give Opportunities to Give Carolina Excellence Scholarship Endowment Facility Projects Carolina Football Projects Finley Golf Renovation Chewning Tennis Center Karen Shelton Stadium Soccer & Lacrosse Stadium Track & Field Complex Team Support Team Giving Options The Annual Fund FORevHER Tar Heels Student-Athlete Support Ways to Give Give Online Cash Gifts Scheduled Payments Payroll Deduction Planned Giving Carolina Forever Society Gift Types Additional Resources Stock/Transfer Gifts Matching Gifts Tax Information About Us What is The Rams Club? FAQs Staff & Leadership Join Our Team Contact The Rams Club Log In Join Now Log In Join Now Open/Close Mobile Menu Staff & Leadership Staff Directory Join Our Team Executive Board of Directors Board of Advisors STAFF DIRECTORY Diane Aldridge Chief Financial Officer & General Counsel 919-843-6408 diane@ramsclub.com Diane serves as the Chief Financial Officer and General Counsel for The Rams Club and is responsible for all legal and financial matters. Diane graduated Phi Beta Kappa from UNC in 1988 earning a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration with a concentration in Accounting. She also attended UNC for law school and earned a JD with honors in 1994. Prior to joining The Rams Club staff in 2002 Diane practiced law for over seven years, concentrating on corporate law, real estate law, and general commercial litigation. Diane is also a Certified Public Accountant, having worked with Ernst & Young in Raleigh before returning to law school to pursue her law degree. A native of Cary, NC, Diane and her husband, Sid, live in Chapel Hill. Brian Bersticker Director of Member Services 919-843-6437 brian@ramsclub.com Brian serves as the Director of Member Services, as well as part of the Rams Club Leadership Team. His primary responsibilities include coordinating the Member Services Team which oversees events, stewardship, tickets and parking, and hospitality. Brian graduated from UNC in 2001 with a BA in Geography. He was a four-year letterman with the UNC basketball program during his time as a student-athlete. During his career Brian played in two Final Fours and won 2 ACC championships. Prior to his current role with The Rams Club Brian spent 10 years working in the UNC Ticket Office as the Associate Director of Ticket Operations, as well as 4 years as the Director of Member Benefits with the Rams Club. A native of Virginia Beach, VA, Brian currently lives in Durham with his wife Beth, a 2006 UNC graduate and Women’s Golf letter winner, and their sons, Grayson and Quinn. Aidan Blakely CAH Office Intern aidan@ramsclub.com Aidan is the Office Intern for Carolina Athletic Hospitality and oversees hiring and managing of all staff members for Football, Basketball, and Baseball game days. Aidan will be a 2025 fall graduate from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, earning a B.A. in Sport Administration. During his time at UNC, Aidan served as member of Cru. Aidan served as the CAH Game Day Intern this past season. Cathy Brickhouse Morning Receptionist 919-843-6411 cathy@ramsclub.com Cathy Brickhouse joined The Rams Club staff in July 2019, performing morning Reception Desk responsibilities. Along with her morning desk duties, Cathy assists member services and special events, as well as gameday events with The Rams Club. Cathy moved to North Carolina in 1969. Her daughters were raised in Hillsborough, NC, and today, each one of them, along with her grandchildren, live in North Carolina. Trips to visit them occur often. Prior to her employment with The Rams Club, Cathy worked in an administrative role with Smith Breeden Associates, for the Chairman of the Board, followed by Massage Envy at Southpoint and Cary Parkside. She also obtained her CNA certificate, then worked in a private duty setting. Earlier, she worked in the field of dentistry for 23+ years. Cathy enjoys time with her family and friends, as well as antiquing, thrift shopping, travel, cooking, baking and entertaining. Jordan Buck Director of Principal & Major Gifts Operations 919-843-0428 jordan@ramsclub.com Jordan coordinates with various teams on projects that advance our fundraising operation and manages a staff that supports the Principal and Major Gifts team. She joined The Rams Club staff in 2014 as a member of the former Carolina Fan Development Team. Jordan graduated from N.C. State University with a B.S. in Sport Management. Prior to working for The Rams Club, she spent five seasons in Minor League Baseball, working for the Carolina Mudcats and the Gwinnett Braves in a variety of community relations and sales roles. Jordan is a native and current resident of Chapel Hill . Carter Burleson Assistant Director of Annual Giving 919-445-1489 carter@ramsclub.com Carter serves as the Assistant Director of Annual Giving. Her primary responsibilities include oversight of our membership programs (Kids Club, Junior Rams Club, and Student Rams Club) as well as fundraising for our recent graduates of Carolina through the Recent Graduate program. She will assist in Annual Fund member acquisition and retention of the membership programs as well as directly fundraise for our Recent Graduate members. Carter graduated from UNC Charlotte in 2022 with a B.A. in Communications and graduated from UNC with her Master’s in Sport Administration (May 2024). Carter served as a Graduate Assistant for The Rams Club as part of the Sport Administration Graduate Program assisting in tickets and donations, Annual Fund operations and stewardship surrounding gamedays and events. Prior to The Rams Club, Carter spent three years working for Charlotte Football as an On-Campus Recruiting Assistant and a year as an Athletic Marketing Intern while at UNCC. A native of Pittsboro, N.C., Carter now lives in Chapel Hill. Gary Burns Senior Associate Major Gifts Director 919-843-6405 gary@ramsclub.com Gary joined The Rams Club staff in 2013 and is responsible for the solicitation and cultivation of major gifts. Gary graduated from UNC in 1982 with a BS in Industrial Relations. A three-time lacrosse All-America Selection during his time at UNC, Gary was a part of two NCAA Championships. Prior to his work with The Rams Club, Gary worked in real estate development for East West Partners. Gary resides in Chapel Hill with his wife Jami, a two time UNC-graduate. They have two children- Casey and Stephen. Casey, a 2010 UNC graduate and Morehead-Cain Scholar, was a member of two NCAA Championship UNC field hockey teams. Stephen also graduated from UNC in 2013 and was a member of the UNC Men’s Lacrosse team. Karlie Cain Director of the Annual Fund and Lead Annual Gifts 919-843-3856 karlie@ramsclub.com Karlie Cain serves as the Director of the Annual Fund & Lead Annual Gifts, where she provides strategic leadership and oversight for annual giving and membership initiatives. In this role, she guides a team focused on member acquisition, retention, and engagement, while developing innovative processes that strengthen fundraising operations across The Rams Club. Karlie also offers strategic oversight for leadership annual giving levels and serves as the fundraising liaison for Carolina Women’s Basketball. Karlie graduated from Presbyterian College in 2014 with a B.A. in Business Administration. A native of Tega Cay, S.C., Karlie and her husband, Matt, live in Chapel Hill with their two children, Kennedy and Wesley. Brian Chacos Major Gifts Director 404-861-7735 chacos@ramsclub.com Brian’s primary responsibilities include the cultivation and solicitation of major gifts for scholarships, capital campaigns and sport endowments. Previously, Brian was the Director of Sales & Fan Development and Director of Scholarship Donor Development & Student-Athlete Relations. Brian, a football scholarship student-athlete, graduated from the University of North Carolina in 2006 with a degree in Sociology. During his time at Carolina, the football team went to the Peach Bowl in 2001 and the Continental Tire Bowl in 2004. Brian’s father, Andy Chacos ’74, also played for the Tar Heels under Bill Dooley as a tight end. Prior to working with The Rams Club, Brian was employed as a Technical Director for Insight Global Inc., an Account Executive for the Atlanta Falcons front office, a Business Development Executive for the Carolina Hurricanes front office, and an Executive for Sales/Marketing and Radio for WCHL. Brian is involved with many local community organizations as a Board Member for Habitat for Humanity – Orange County, NC, Board of Directors Member for The National Football Foundation – Bill Dooley Chapter, UNC Lineberger Community Engagement Committee Member, SECU Family House – YP Board Member, Board Of Directors Member and Ambassador for the Carolina Club, member of the East Chapel Hill Rotary Club. A native of Darien, Conn., Brian now resides in Chapel Hill with his wife, Courtney, their daughter, Zoe Violet and son Jasper. Emily Coble Senior Director of Finance 919-843-6424 emily@ramsclub.com Emily serves as the Senior Director of Finance for The Rams Club, overseeing the day to day accounting functions. She is the contact person for stock and wire transfers. She helps maintain general ledger and accounting records, assist with financial reporting requirements, assist with the audit, budget, and tax preparation, and respond to other special requests and inquires. Emily graduated from UNC in 1997 earning a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration. She also graduated from UNC with a Master of Accounting in 1998. Prior to joining The Rams Club staff in October 2015, Emily worked as Cash Manager for over seven years, with The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Emily is also a Certified Public Accountant, having worked with Stout, Stuart, McGowen & King, LLP in Burlington for 9 years before returning to UNC Chapel Hill to work as a Merchant Card Accountant for two years. A native of Graham, N.C., Emily still resides there with her husband Rodney and their daughter Allee. Sophia Czekalski Assistant Director of Communications 919-962-1044 sophia@ramsclub.com As Assistant Director of Communications, Sophia works directly with the Director of Communications to execute communications efforts for The Rams Club and deliver outstanding communications collateral for teams and colleagues within the organization to maximize fundraising on behalf of Carolina Athletics. She previously served as a Communications Intern at The Rams Club. Sophia graduated from UNC-Chapel Hill in 2022 with a degree in Media and Journalism. During her time at Carolina, she worked for the Carolina Football program as a Football Video Student Manager. Her other previous roles include Sports Desk Staff Writer for The Daily Tar Heel and Student Reporter for the journalism school’s student-run sports broadcasting show, Sports Xtra. Originally from Silver Spring, Maryland, Sophia now resides in Chapel Hill. Olivia Dail Assistant Director of Communications 919-843--7511 olivia@ramsclub.com As Assistant Director of Communications, Olivia works with the Director of Communications to create print and digital collateral for The Rams Club’s marketing, communication, and fundraising efforts. Olivia graduated from NC State in 2023 with a degree in Sport Management, and minors in Communication and Leadership. Prior to her graduation, Olivia completed a season-long internship with the Charlotte Hornets as a digital design intern for the 2023-24 season. During her time at NC State, Olivia worked with the athletic department as a creative services intern and spent a summer with the Wilson Tobs summer-league baseball team as their digital media and graphics intern. Olivia is originally from Raleigh, NC. Lizzie Dawson Director of Data Strategy and Fundraising Systems 919-962-9163 lizzie@ramsclub.com Lizzie serves as the Director of Innovation and Technology, and her primary responsibilities include managing the annual membership cycle and maintaining the donor database. Lizzie graduated from UNC in 2012 with a B.A. in Exercise and Sport Science (Sport Administration). Prior to her current role with The Rams Club, Lizzie served as the Director of the Annual Fund, Member Services Coordinator, Assistant Director of Ticket Operations for NC State, Ticket Office Assistant for UConn and Ticket Office student intern for UNC. A native of Burlington, N.C., Lizzie currently lives in Hillsborough with her husband Zack, a two-time UNC graduate and Men’s Track and Field letter winner. Abbie Flower Accountant 919-843-5711 abbie@ramsclub.com Abigail serves as the Accountant for the Rams Club, where she supports the Chief Financial Officer and Controller in all financial matters. Abigail earned her Bachelor of Science from Liberty University in 2015 and completed a Master of Education in Sports Leadership at Virginia Commonwealth University in 2017. Before joining the Rams Club, she served as Assistant Director of Business Operations at the University of Wisconsin–Madison. A former track and field student-athlete, Abigail now resides in Chapel Hill. Eric Hulse Associate Director of Annual Giving 919-843-5782 ehulse@ramsclub.com Eric serves as the Associate Director of Annual Giving. His primary responsibilities include developing an overall outreach strategy to renew, retain, and acquire Rams Club members, building member acquisition and growth plans with prospective members, developing new campaigns for increased annual support, and supporting the Annual Fund cycle. Prior to joining the Rams Club in December 2023, he worked at Thomas Jefferson University and Arcadia University, and also spent time working in the athletic departments at the University of Richmond, UNC Greensboro, and Stony Brook University. Eric received his bachelor’s degree in Sport Management from SUNY Cortland and earned a master’s degree in Higher Education Administration from Stony Brook University. A native of Wading River, N.Y., Eric now resides in Raleigh. Burt Jenkins Major Gifts Director 919-843-6639 burt@ramsclub.com Burt’s primary responsibilities include the cultivation of major gifts for scholarships, capital campaigns and sport endowments. Burt graduated from the University of North Carolina in 2002 with degree in Political Science. Prior to joining the Rams Club team, Burt served as a Major Gift Director at the UNC Health Foundation focusing on fundraising for women’s cancers for the UNC Lineberger Comprehensive Cancer Center. Prior to his work in development, Burt worked in corporate partnership sales at the University of North Carolina, Clemson University and East Carolina University. Lastly, Burt worked at Blue Cross NC serving in various roles on their sports marketing team. A native of Eden, NC, Burt now resides in Durham with his wife, Cara, and their daughters, Avery and Caroline. Kim Jones Director of Signature Events & Premium Seating 919-843-6433 kim@ramsclub.com Kim’s primary responsibilities include special event creation and implementation, engagement, hospitality, stewardship and premium seating. She graduated from UNC-Greensboro with a B.S. in Recreation Management and holds a master’s degree in Sports Administration from Georgia State University. Prior to joining the Rams Club staff, Kim worked with the UNC Ticket Office and several minor league baseball teams. A native of Winston-Salem, Kim lives in Durham with her husband Chris and their sons, Ben and Peyton. Matt Jones Senior Data Analyst 919-698-5409 mjones@ramsclub.com Matt currently serves as a Senior Data Analyst working with both The Rams Club and Carolina Athletics. His primary responsibilities include data preparation, analysis and reporting to evaluate performance and impact of analytics initiatives. Matt graduated from Carolina in 2016 with a dual bachelor’s degree in Applied Mathematics and Mathematical Decision Sciences. Matt worked with the Women’s Soccer team during his four years in undergrad, including during their National Championship in 2012. Matt continued his education at Carolina and graduated in 2018 with a master’s degree in Statistics. During his time as a graduate student, Matt continued working with the Women’s Soccer team and served as a data analyst intern with Carolina Athletics. Originally a native of Kansas City, Mo., Matt has lived in Chapel Hill since 1997. Caitlin Kaus Assistant Director of Stewardship 919-445-1476 caitlin@ramsclub.com Caitlin serves as the Assistant Director of Stewardship for The Rams Club. Her primary responsibilities include supporting strategic stewardship initiatives, managing the comprehensive gift acknowledgement process and impact reporting, and assisting with efforts to promote The Rams Club’s fundraising priorities and enhance the overall donor experience. Caitlin graduated from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill in 2025 with a B.A. in Political Science and Peace, War, & Defense with a concentration in International Security & Intelligence and a minor in Advertising & Public Relations. As an undergraduate at Carolina, she served as the Lead Undergraduate Development Intern for The Rams Club. A native of Raleigh, NC, Caitlin now lives in Chapel Hill. Branch Knight Development Intern - Member Services 919-962-9383 branch@ramsclub.com Branch joined The Rams Club in May 2025 as a Graduate Assistant for Member Services. Branch’s primary responsibilities include assisting Rams Club members with tickets and donations, Annual Fund operations, and stewardship initiatives surrounding gamedays and events. Branch earned his Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration at Auburn University in 2020 and his J.D. from The University of North Carolina School of Law in 2024. Branch is now pursuing his Master’s degree in Sport Administration from UNC. A native of Cullman, AL, Branch now lives in Durham with his wife, Ellenor. Beth MacKethan Senior Philanthropy Officer 919-843-6448 beth@ramsclub.com Beth serves as the Senior Philanthropy Officer for the Rams Club.  Beth specializes in complex charitable gifts that require some measure of tax, legal or financial planning. She partners with donors, their advisors, and other gift officers to cultivate and facilitate smart philanthropic strategies to support scholarships, capital projects, team support and other identified priorities of the Rams Club and its supporters. Prior to joining the Rams Club team, Beth served as the Senior Director of Gift Planning at Carolina where she partnered with fundraisers campus-wide, including the Vice Chancellor of Development and the Principal Gifts team, to secure private support for the University. Prior to her work in development, Beth was a tax consultant at KPMG LLP and advised clients on a variety of tax strategies and compliance matters. Beth received her B.A. in American Studies & English from William Smith College, her J.D. from North Carolina Central University, and her LL.M. in Taxation from the University of Florida.  She is a licensed member of the North Carolina Bar. A native of Chapel Hill, Beth lives in Mebane with her husband Alex and their family. Mimi Martens Senior Manager of Carolina Athletic Hospitality 919-843-3058 mimi@ramsclub.com As Senior Manager of Carolina Athletic Hospitality, Mimi oversees all premium seating management for Kenan Stadium, the Smith Center, and Boshamer Stadium. Originally from Birmingham, Alabama, Mimi made the made the move to Chapel Hill to accept the role of Hospitality Manager with Carolina Athletic Hospitality. She attended Auburn University, pursuing a degree in Hospitality Management with an Event Management Focus as well as a minor in Business. Previously, Mimi has worked for the Tennessee Titans in Premium Services and Auburn University Athletics with on-campus recruiting. When she’s not cheering on the Tar Heels, she can be found on FaceTime with her family, shopping, or helping people find what they need at Lululemon. Emilee McCollum Director of Ticketing & Parking Operations 919-843-6404 emilee@ramsclub.com Emilee serves as the Director of Ticketing & Parking Operations. Her key responsibilities include managing all ticketing and parking functions for The Rams Club and its members, in collaboration with the UNC Athletics Ticket Office. She also coordinates premium seating leases and assignments, Basketball seating allocations, and the implementation of the Football Equity Seating Plan. Emilee was a scholarship student-athlete (Women’s Swimming) at Clarion University of Pennsylvania, where she earned a B.S. in Business Administration in 2015. She later completed a Master’s degree in Sport Administration from UNC Chapel Hill in 2017. Before joining The Rams Club, Emilee worked as the Assistant Director of Ticket Operations for the UNC Athletics Ticket Office for 2 years and served as the Assistant Director of the Dean E. Smith Center for 3 years. Originally from Warren, Ohio, Emilee now resides in Apex, North Carolina, with her husband, Ryan, and their daughter, Rosie. Lewis Mickey Major Gifts Director 919-843-6445 lewis@ramsclub.com Lewis’ primary responsibilities include the cultivation and solicitation of major gifts for scholarships, capital campaigns and sport endowments. Lewis also works as the fundraising liaison to the Fencing and Women’s Lacrosse programs. Lewis has been with The Rams Club since 2019, serving as a full-time Graduate Assistant for the Member Services and Annual Fund teams and Assistant Director for Major Gifts. Lewis earned his master’s degree in Exercise and Sport Science (Sport Administration) from UNC in 2020. Prior to his time in Chapel Hill, Lewis worked in the athletic department at the University of Iowa, where he graduated with a B.S. in Sport and Recreation Management and a minor in Business Administration. A native of Cedar Falls, Iowa, Lewis now lives in Durham. John Montgomery Executive Director Emeritus 919-843-2000 john@ramsclub.com John Montgomery was Executive Director of the Educational Foundation, Inc. from 2001-August 2025. Under his leadership, The Rams Club saw significant growth in fundraising for Carolina Athletics and Tar Heel student-athletes, as well as record-breaking membership increases. In his tenure as Executive Director, just the third in Rams Club history, Montgomery guided fundraising efforts for more than 40 capital projects and launched FORevHER Tar Heels, in recognition and support of Carolina’s women’s teams. In 2009, he was named the Division I Fundraiser of the Year by the National Association of Athletic Development Directors (NAADD). Prior to his time at the Rams Club, John led the fundraising efforts at Radford University, UNC Greensboro, and Southern Methodist University. He received his undergraduate degree from Radford before earning his master’s in Sport Administration from Western Illinois University. Katie O'Shaughnessy Accounts Payable & Stock Gift Coordinator 919-843-5392 katie@ramsclub.com Katie serves as the Accounting Assistant and Gift Processing Administrator for the Rams Club. In this role, she is responsible for the accounts payable processes, as well as the posting of cash to the general ledger. She is also responsible for all the stock transactions.  Katie also assists with gift processing duties, and additional financial responsibilities as assigned. Katie graduated from Connecticut College in 1990, with a bachelor’s degree in Psychology, and then from Indiana University in 1993, with a master’s degree in Sport Management and Marketing. Prior to joining the Rams Club, Katie worked as a teacher assistant for Orange County Schools for 11 years, and previously served as the head Women’s Soccer Coach at Western Michigan University. Katie lives in Hillsborough with her husband Patrick. They have two children, Meghan, UNC-Chapel Hill class of 2020, and Daniel, UNC-Chapel Hill class of 2023. Deanna Patrick Afternoon Receptionist 919-843-6413 deanna@ramsclub.com Deanna, a track and field scholarship student-athlete, graduated from Butler University with a B.S. in Elementary Education and a minor in Spanish. Prior to joining The Rams Club, Deanna worked as Childcare Director for the Metro Atlanta YMCA and as the School and Family Programs Director at Kidzu Children’s Museum in Chapel Hill. A native of Casey, Ill. (The Little Town That Made It Big), she now resides in Chapel Hill with her husband, Jimmy, and their son, JT. Ava Pearson Associate Hospitality Manager 919-230-0334 ava@ramsclub.com As Associate Manager of Carolina Athletic Hospitality, Ava works to plan and facilitate all special events hosted in the Blue Zone; in addition to executing game days in the premium areas of Kenan Stadium, the Smith Center, Carmichael Arena, and Boshamer Stadium. Born in Chapel Hill and being a third generation Carolina alumni, Ava is a true born and bred Tar Heel! She is a 2024 graduate from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill earning a B.A in Sport Administration and was a member of the Exercise and Sport Science Honor Society, Phi Epsilon Kappa. While attending Carolina, Ava was on the UNC Carolina Girls Dance Team, a member of Zeta Tau Alpha, crowned UNC Homecoming Royal, and interned for Carolina Football in player development, operations, and recruitment. Seth Reeves Executive Director 919-843-6422 seth@ramsclub.com Seth Reeves was named Executive Director of the Educational Foundation, Inc. in September 2025. He oversees one of the country’s most successful collegiate athletic fundraising teams – one that provides world-class educational and athletic opportunities for Tar Heel student-athletes. Prior to his role as Executive Director, Seth was The Educational Foundation’s Chief Revenue and Operations Officer, where his primary responsibilities included the cultivation and solicitation of major gifts for scholarships, capital campaigns, and sport endowments. Seth graduated from UNC in 2005 with his master’s degree in Exercise and Sport Science (Sport Administration). He served in a number of roles with Tar Heel Sports Properties at UNC before joining The Rams Club in 2016. Prior to his time in Chapel Hill, Seth was a consultant for Accenture and also graduated from the University of Virginia, where he earned his bachelor’s degree in Commerce. A native of Newport News, Va., Seth lives in Apex, N.C., with his wife, Wendy, and their two children, Jacob and Emily. Jip Richards Senior Director of Major Gifts 919-962-9004 jip@ramsclub.com Jip’s primary responsibilities include the cultivation and solicitation of major gifts for scholarships, capital campaigns and sport endowments. Jip also works as the fundraising liaison to the Fencing, Rowing, and Swimming & Diving programs. Jip graduated from UNC in 2016 with his master’s degree in Exercise and Sport Science (Sport Administration). He worked with Tar Heel Sports Properties at UNC before joining The Rams Club in 2017. In 2014, Jip graduated from Davidson College where he was a four-year letterman on the Wildcats baseball team. A native of Davidson, N.C., Jip now resides in Chapel Hill. Max Roitman Development Intern - Member Services 919-962-9006 max@ramsclub.com Max joined The Rams Club in August 2025 as a Development Intern for Member Services. Max’s primary responsibilities include assisting Rams Club members with tickets and donations, Annual Fund operations, and stewardship initiatives for membership programs. Max earned his Bachelor’s degree in Human Development at Cornell University in 2024 and spent the following year as an Assistant to the Director of Athletics at his alma mater. A native of Stamford, CT, Max now lives in Chapel Hill. Cindy Shi Human Resources Director 919-843-5771 cindy@ramsclub.com Cindy currently serves as the Human Resources Director, overseeing hiring and onboarding and providing payroll and benefit management to the Rams Club staff. Cindy graduated from Binghamton University in 2017 where she was a two-time captain on the Bearcats swim and dive team. In 2022, Cindy earned a master’s degree in Business Administration from St. Bonaventure University. Prior to arriving at Chapel Hill, Cindy spent three years at St. Bonaventure University, mostly recently, as the Assistant Athletic Director for Business and Finance from 2021-2023. Prior to that, Cindy held the Compliance Coordinator role in 2020. Cindy spent two years at the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference (MAAC) as the Director of Championships from 2018-2020 and the 2017 and 2018 seasons with the New York Giants as the Community Relations Intern and Legal/Human Resources Intern. A native of Princeton, NJ, Cindy resides in Chapel Hill. Morgan Shump Associate Director of Stewardship 919-962-5874 morgan@ramsclub.com Morgan serves as the Associate Director of Stewardship. Her primary responsibilities include: managing the comprehensive gift acknowledgement process, managing Annual Fund stewardship efforts, and assisting with efforts to promote The Rams Club’s fundraising priorities. Morgan earned a B.A. in Media and Journalism – Public Relations from UNC in 2016 and a Master of Business Administration and Master of Sports Administration from Ohio University in 2019. During graduate school, she served as a Graduate Assistant for The Ohio Bobcat Club. Prior to joining The Rams Club staff, Morgan spent four years working for Georgia Southern Athletics as the Assistant Athletic Director for Administration. A native of Snow Camp, N.C., Morgan and her husband, Joel, now live in Durham. Collin Sonderman Assistant Director of Major Gifts 919-445-1477 collin@ramsclub.com Collin’s primary responsibilities include assisting with membership communication, stewardship, special events and fundraising. Collin returned to The Rams Club after spending three years at Belmont University in Nashville, TN as the Assistant Director and most recently the Associate Director of Athletic Development. Prior to his time in the Music City, Collin was an Intern for Member Services at The Rams Club. He graduated from UNCW with a B.A. in Marketing Strategy. A native of Indianapolis, IN, Collin and his wife, Emily, live in Chapel Hill. Jason Steinberg Gift Processing Coordinator 919-843-6440 jason@ramsclub.com Jason joined The Rams Club in September 2021 as the gift processing administrator. Jason graduated from Carolina in 2009 with a B.A. in Exercise and Sport Science (Sport Administration), where he also was a student worker in the Ticket Office for UNC. Prior to joining The Rams Club, Jason served as Director of Ticket Services at East Carolina University, Associate Director of Ticket Operations for UNC and as a Ticket Office intern at Michigan State University. A native of Whiteville, N.C., Jason currently lives in Durham. Emily Stevens Major Gifts Director 919-923-2246 estevens@ramsclub.com Emily’s primary responsibilities include the cultivation and solicitation of major gifts for scholarships, capital projects and sport endowments. Emily graduated from UNC in 1996 with a Bachelor of Arts in Education, double-major in Physical Education and Communication Studies. While an undergrad, Emily worked at the Phonathon, the Carolina Football Office with Coach Mack Brown, the North Carolina High School Athletic Association with the late great Charlie Adams and as intern in The Rams Club. Emily received a Master of Sports Administration from Ohio University in 1997. After graduate school, she interned at the National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics (NACDA) with the National Association of Athletics Development Directors (NAADD) in Cleveland, Ohio, then worked as marketing manager at Host Communications, Inc. in Dallas, Texas, before returning to Chapel Hill as an account executive with Learfield at Tar Heel Sports Properties. Since 2001, Emily has served in key Carolina fundraising roles across campus in the Office of University Development Office, the Arts & Sciences Foundation, the UNC Health Foundation and The Rams Club (2019). Emily was born in Norfolk, Va., Tar Heel bred in Smithfield, N.C., and resides in Chapel Hill. Katie Sweet Director of Communications 919-843-5796 ksweet@ramsclub.com Katie is the Director of Communications. In her role, she collaborates with her team and colleagues on all things communications for The Rams Club, including fundraising collateral, storytelling and digital communications. Prior to joining The Rams Club in January 2024, Katie worked in media relations at the Orlando Magic, in communications at the V Foundation for Cancer Research and as an executive communications specialist at DPR Construction. She received her bachelor’s degree from UNC’s Hussman School of Journalism and Media and was a four-year letter winner on the Fencing team. Katie lives in Raleigh with her husband, Brian, and their three children, Jackson (UNC, class of 2025), Avery, and Nicholas. Matt Terrell Chief Strategy & Communications Officer 919-843-6412 matt@ramsclub.com Matt is the Chief Strategy & Communications Officer. In his role, Matt works closely with the staff and The Rams Club boards to develop best strategic practices for the organization. He also oversees the communications program for the organization. Matt received his bachelor’s degree from Davidson College before earning a master’s in Sport Management from the University of Richmond. Prior to his time with The Rams Club, Matt has worked in athletic departments at Davidson, SMU, and East Tennessee State, and enjoyed a previous stint with The Rams Club. A native of North Carolina and current resident of Cary, Matt and his wife, Kat, have two daughters, Kaylee and Reagan. Keana Upshaw Lead Annual Gift Director 919-962-5555 keana@ramsclub.com Keana’s primary responsibilities include the cultivation and solicitation of lead annual gifts to support the Annual Fund. Additionally, Keana focuses on prospect discovery and assisting in stewardship strategy for lead annual giving levels. Keana has been with The Rams Club since 2021, serving as a full-time Graduate Assistant for the Member Services team and then the Assistant Director of Stewardship. Keana is earning her master’s degree in Sport Administration from UNC. Prior to her time in Chapel Hill, Keana worked in ticket sales for athletics at the University of Oklahoma, where she graduated in 2018 with a degree in Finance and Marketing. A native of Tulsa, Oklahoma, Keana now lives in Chapel Hill. Sarah Watson Director of Stewardship & Signature Programs 919-843-3466 sarah@ramsclub.com Sarah serves as the Director of Stewardship & Signature Programs. Her primary responsibilities include: developing and managing a comprehensive stewardship plan to ensure all gifts to The Rams Club are appropriately acknowledged and recognized and managing, designing, and supporting the implementation of programmatic strategic priorities linked to The Scholarship Endowment Trust, FORevHER Tar Heels, and Carolina Forever. Sarah earned a B.A. in Exercise and Sport Science – Sport Administration from UNC in 2015 and a M.A. in Sport Administration from UNC in 2020. During graduate school, she served as a Graduate Assistant for The Rams Club, before being promoted to Assistant Director of Stewardship in 2021 and then Director of Stewardship in 2022. Prior to joining The Rams Club staff, Sarah worked for UNC Health, UNC Athletic Event Management and the UNC Athletic Ticket Office. A native of Lumberton, N.C., Sarah now lives in Chapel Hill. Connor Weishaar Associate Director of Major Gifts 919-455-1488 connor@ramsclub.com Connor serves as the Associate Director of Major Gifts for the Rams Club. He has been at the organization since April of 2022, previously serving as the Director of Ticketing and Parking. Connor graduated from the University of Kansas in 2018, earning a Bachelor of Science in Sport Management with a business minor. Connor also graduated from Texas Christian University with his MBA in 2020. Prior to joining The Rams Club, Connor served as the Director of Ticket Operations at Baylor University. Before Baylor, Connor was the Graduate Assistant for Ticket Operations at TCU. Dawn Williams Donor Relations Specialist & Director of Administrative Support 919-843-3363 dwilliams@ramsclub.com Dawn serves as Donor Relations Specialist & Director of Administrative Support, assisting with membership communication, stewardship, special events and fundraising.  Previously, she worked as Assistant Director of Major Gifts at The Rams Club. She is a graduate of Peace College and the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, with a B.A. in Speech Communications. Prior to joining the Rams Club staff, Dawn worked in the UNC Football Department as the morning receptionist, and as an assistant for Game Day recruiting events. Dawn Is originally from Oxford, N.C., and currently resides in Chapel Hill. She has three daughters: Taylor, Meredith and Emily. Ashton Wooten Development Intern - Member Services 919-962-1063 ashton@ramsclub.com Ashton joined the Rams Club in May 2025 as a Graduate Assistant. Ashton’s primary responsibilities include assisting Rams Club members with tickets and donations, Annual Fund operations, and stewardship initiatives surrounding gamedays and events. Ashton earned her Bachelor’s degree in Sport Management from North Carolina State University in December 2023 and is currently pursuing a Master’s Degree in Sport Administration at UNC. She has previously worked as a Development Assistant for the Deacon Club at Wake Forest University. She also spent time working in Sponsor Services for the Wyndham Championship and the Masters Tournament. A native of High Point, NC, Ashton now lives in Chapel Hill. Mary Brooke Wright Accountant 919-962-1116 marybrooke@ramsclub.com Mary Brooke serves as Accountant for the Rams Club and is responsible for supporting the Chief Financial Officer and Controller with all financial related matters including processing vendor invoices, tracking capital projects, and various account reconciliations. Mary Brooke graduated from the University of North Carolina at Greensboro in 2007 with a Bachelor of Arts in English, and then continued to receive a degree in Accounting from Guilford College in 2011. Prior to coming to work for the Rams Club in 2015, she worked in tax accounting, and as a Financial Analyst/Accountant for a large educational publishing firm in Greensboro, N.C. Originally from Siler City, N.C, Mary Brooke currently resides in Chapel Hill and enjoys spending time with friends and family. Kronenberg, LCSW, PPSC DIRECTOR OF TRAINING INSTITUTE Read more Janny Wong, LMFT, PPSC DIRECTOR OF FU YAU PROJECT Read more Kristin Chun, LMFT DIRECTOR OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES AND WELLNESS CENTERS Read more Vivian Vong, LMFT DIRECTOR OF CAAP COUNSELING & PRE-VOCATIONAL SERVICES Read more Rebecca Peng, LMFT DIRECTOR OF CALWORKS COUNSELING AND PRE-VOCATIONAL SERVICES Read more Richard Zevin, LCSW DIRECTOR OF DIVISION OF PEER-BASED SERVICES Read more Mory Chhom, MPH DIRECTOR OF POPULATION-FOCUSED PREVENTION EARLY INTERVENTION Read more Chiao-Jung Huang, MA DIRECTOR OF BRODERICK ST ADULT RESIDENTIAL FACILITY Read more Sonja Scott, MPA ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF CRISIS RESPONSE & STREET BASED SERVICES Read more Nicole Ng, MA ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF PEER COUNSELING & SUPPORT SERVICES Read more Kristen Hay ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF HIRE-ABILITY Read more Jei Watkins, PsyD ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF KINDEZI BLACK PERINATAL WELLNESS Read more Lombeh Harrison, LMFT ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF STREET HEALTH Read more Ida Poberezovsky, LMFT ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF TRAINING Read more Board of Directors Alum Highlight Interview with Anoshua Chaudhuri, watch full video on RAMS Youtube channel . Anoshua Chaudhuri, PhD Senior Director of CEETL and Lam-Larsen Distinguished Professor of Economics at San Francisco State University Anoshua Chaudhuri served the RAMS Board for 17 impactful years. Anoshua brought her professional expertise as a health economist and her passion for teaching which helped the organization navigate through a tumultuous economic time during the 2008 housing crisis and recession. Since then she has played a critical role in the advancement of the organization. Her support and encouragement is tangible, motivating staff as RAMS has grown exponentially over the last several years. While she has stepped down from her Board role, we know her commitment will continue to the organization and working to better the lives of her fellow San Franciscans and neighbors. Board Membership Are you interested in finding meaningful ways to share your experience & expertise, work towards a common goal in support of a social cause, and make a positive impact on the community? Please contact RAMS Board Liaison, Angela Tang by email angelatang@ramsinc.org for more details!
